Articles.Content:
Ever run out of Rocket Part Storage and wanted a way to Compress them for later usage? Pack your Rocket Parts at a 10:1 Packed Parts Ratio. Packed Parts Density is the same as Rocket parts, meaning 0.1 Packed Part has the same Density as 10 Rocket parts.

This is just MM.cfg files and an old Converter from v0.18 which has been re-purposed for this addon.

Only Requirement is Roverdude's Regolith, as the converter code uses the "REGO_ModuleResourceConverter" module.

DOWNLOAD LINK

GitHub: PackedParts/releases

License

PackedParts is licensed under a Creative Commons 4.0 Attribution Non-Commercial license.

v0.2.0

Added ATM support

Changed pack ratio from 100:1 to 10:1

Edited January 10, 2015 by bear67
Thanks, rabidninjawombat for pointing the Regolith out.

Ever run out of Rocket Part Storage and wanted a way to Compress them for later usage? Pack your Rocket Parts at a 100:1 Packed Parts Ratio. Packed Parts Density is the same as Rocket parts, meaning 1 Packed Part has the same Density as 100 Rocket parts.

This is just MM.cfg files and an old Converter from v0.18 which has been re-purposed for this addon.

Only Requirement is Roverdude's Community Resource Pack, as the converter code uses the "REGO_ModuleResourceConverter" module.

DOWNLOAD LINK

GitHub: PackedParts/releases

License

PackedParts is licensed under a Creative Commons 4.0 Attribution Non-Commercial license.

Actually your mod would be dependent on Regolith. (i dont believe the CRP download comes distributed with the Regolith DLL, and the REGO_ModuleResourceConver is in the REgolith DLL) So ya may wanna change that in the description

Otherwise, seems a little like magic to me 100-1 is a massive compression ratio. But to each their own!
